Second review, again, about not being able to obtain a PIN. I've tried every way possible to get one and am unable. Deleting this app and relying on social media is probably better for notification of exposure. Stay healthy!
replyContent: Hi Erica! You may obtain a PIN by contacting the CCNC call center at 844-628-7223 (opt. 9), via ncdhhs.gov/slowcovidncpin, or by calling your Local Health Department. Test results may take 24-hours to be submitted by the provider/lab and be received by the health department, so please try again the next day if your PIN isn't immediately available.

content: Great. Google give me the Google photo app
The app isn't actually checking for exposure. Opened it today and it was last checked for exposure three weeks ago.
replyContent: Hi! This is an issue with Samsung devices. Samsung will be releasing an OEM update soon. In the meantime you can prevent the SlowCOVIDNC app from being snoozed by the Samsung battery device care service. Open your phone’s Settings and go to Device Care > Battery > App power management > Apps that won't be put to sleep > and Add SlowCOVIDNC. Thanks!

replyContent: Hi Karen! Please reach out to your local health department (https://www.ncdhhs.gov/divisions/public-health/county-health-departments) and explain that your test results are not showing up in the NC-COVID database. The LHD can make sure that all your information is correct in the system and should be able to assist you in obtaining a PIN. Thanks!

replyContent: Hi Linda! Thank you for your feedback. We have worked with the team to resolve any delays with exposure notifications. There are 15 states in production, with an additional 4 in pilot to join this collaborative effort as of Dec. 1, 2020.

replyContent: In NC all positive COVID-19 tests must be reported to the health authority. Once received, a PIN is automatically generated. Please note that test results may take 24-hours to be submitted by the provider or lab and be received by the health authority, so if your PIN is not immediately available, please try again the next day. Thanks!

replyContent: You can see the regular exposure checks through settings: Settings > Google > COVID-10 Exposure Notifications (should be on) > Exposure Checks. This shows requests made by apps to check for potential exposure to COVID-19 over the past 14 days. If there are issues, please email NCHealthIT@dhhs.nc.gov w/ a screenshot so we can troubleshoot. Thanks!

Thanks!

content: Cool

Thought this app would be useful, until I saw that in order for it to work it needs bluetooth enabled all the time. It is never a good idea to have this on all the time OR to encourage people to keep it on. If you are reading this, be aware anyone with any third party software on their phone can easily steal your info if you are within bluetooth communication vicinity. There might not be any harm in this app itself, but enabling bluetooth in public areas is asking for trouble from cyber theives.

replyContent: Hi, Lex! Your Google Play services may be out of date, try: 1. Uninstall SlowCOVIDNC 2. Open your phone's settings 3. Tap “Apps” (or “Apps & notifications”) and then “See all apps” 4. Scroll down and tap Google Play services 5. Scroll down and tap “App Details” 6. Tap Update or Install 7. Re-install SlowCOVIDNC.

content: Only just learned about this App and installed it instantly. This seems like a great App, I wish there was a mailing to inform us about this App as I think many more people would then hear about it and install it, which would make the App so much more effective.

This is a great idea

not recommended!! don't download!! only trust the news on tv!! i would not trust these apps because i have heard on the real news that these could possibly be scams and there have been some reports that people did get scammed!

Little to no impact on my phone performance and battery life. Appears to work as described, but many more people in North Carolina need to install this app. This app can help to slow the spread of Covid-19 by alerting you to early possible exposure to someone who tested positive. This app needs to be promoted more prominently on social media so people will know it's available. I found it by chance on the Google Play app.
Good

It's not very effective if the only thing that ever happens when I try to enable it is that it says "internal error". Edit: I had already done what they said to do in their response because I saw it in a response to someone else's review. It didn't fix the problem.
replyContent: Hi Zarahti, to further troubleshoot this issue, please email us at NCHealthIT@dhhs.nc.gov. Thank you!

content: Easy to use and doesn't get in the way.

I got a canned response from the developers saying yes it uses battery but not much. You are wrong. My phone needed 3x the charging. For the 3 days I had it installed. I wish it worked as they say. I installed this thinking it would help. But can't keep using it. My battery died remarkably fast. Had I gone out more I would have been without a phone, and then the app can't work with a dead phone.
replyContent: The app was tested extensively for battery life by Apple and Google, however if your experience is different, we’d like to dive deeper to find out why you are seeing a drain on your battery. Please email us at NCHealthIT@dhhs.nc.gov if you would like to move forward with this. Thank you for reporting this issue, Tbird 66.

content: App works well but needs to allow bluetooth to be turned off and remove the persistent notification. You don't the app running inside your house. In response, I know you can turn bluetooth off, the issue is the notification to turn bluetooth back on will keep coming up even if you dismiss it. Thx.
replyContent: The notification is presented because users were concerned they’d forget to re-enable and therefore miss possible exposures. It was a design choice based upon what would help users remember to re-enable. We do appreciate your feedback and will share with our team.

content: So far so good. Seems to be working. It will only truly work if more people get it and actually log their positive results. It's all anonymous! And it will save lives! The app is super easy to use (literally you don't even have to do anything) and it's fast and not glitchy. Very very simple and clear.

Doesn't work. I tried to report my positive test results, but can't get a pin to do so. The website and the people on the phone both say I'm not in their system. What good can this do if it can't even accept positive test results to inform others? Edit to respond to their response: My positive test result was on 10/8/20 from a test on 10/6/20. It should be in their system. This app clearly can't be trusted to do what it's intended to do if it can't even verify current positive tests.
replyContent: Agreed. If this is your test date, it should be in the system and you should have a PIN. The CCNC phone number should be able to provide you with a PIN: 844-628-7223. Alternatively, speak with someone at your Local Health Department. You can find contact information here: https://www.ncdhhs.gov/divisions/public-health/county-health-departments

content: Fun
Protect myself

Update (10/11/20). App has had no impact on phone. I'm sad to see so few D/L's.This App can help reduce the spread by quicker notification of exposure so individuals can take appropriate actions. No, it won't stop the spread but it can slow it down, help reduce the load on our health system and reduce the cost and time of notification. NEEDED: State to increase PSA's, local TV and radio stations to increase awareness of it, and Corp. Leaders to encourage it's use. Good luck.
Well done. Very clear how it works and maintains privacy. Thank you
Thank you!

Neat idea, but living in Asheville makes me think I need every state's app. Is there any way to make the state apps work with each other? We've had many tourists test positive during their visit and even if they report their result to their state's app, the tokens would never be shared with my app.
replyContent: Hi! The app talks to apps from other states using the Google and Apple technology platform so you will receive an Exposure Notification alert if you are in close contact someone using another state’s app. Visit www.aphl.org/programs/preparedness/Crisis-Management/COVID-19-Response/Pages/exposure-notifications.aspx for other participating states.

content: Never launched it because it requires BT. If you do not use anything the requires BT, then turning it on will decrease your battery life. And BT is how hackers can get access to your phone. As long as it uses BT, I will never use it.
replyContent: Hello, Gregory! The app is designed to minimize impact on battery use. Some battery use is required to support this app, but you should not see a significant impact to your battery life.

Thank you for coming up with this for us as citizens of N.C. God bless you and our leadership. You are in my prayers.

content: It's wonderful that this app even exists. I have been sick and have trouble breathing and no appetite and fever etc on and on for a little under a week but since I wasn't or didn't feel like I was in immediate danger which I have had periods of not really being able to breathe very well I was not going to be tested but because of this app I am going to be tested so that my number gets counted. Your state needs these numbers in order to accurately know where they stand in this pandemic.
What happens when I'm stuck in traffic next to someone who has tested positive? Scaring people into quarantine for no good reason.
replyContent: Hi Kevin! You will only receive an exposure notification if you are in close contact with a positive person. CDC specifies close distance is a distance of 6 feet or less for a duration of 15 minutes or longer. Sitting in traffic next to a positive person should not trigger an exposure notification.

content: What if you have no wifi
replyContent: Hi Ashton! The app does not require WiFi to operate. As long as Bluetooth is turned on, your phone will continue to exchange tokens with others. Thanks!

content: Easy use

I downloaded this app when it first came out. Ive had no problems with it and it doesn't drain my battery. I truly wish more people would download it, just for the simple fact that it can help each other stay safe. At first I was worried that this was some type of government tracking devise, but it's not, thank God! I truly believe our NC health department is trying to help us remain healthy and I truly appreciate the effort. So far, I've not been in contact with anyone positive and Im thankful!
I found this by chance.. it should be pinging on folks TVs and Phones like the hurricane or missing person alerts. Other than that, the app looks pretty good... **Needs users using**
I decided to not open it at all
This is a must have! Does not effect battery life at all, which is impressive. Also it doesn't track my location which is good
It isn't working, or isn't working yet. When I click "Enable Now" it says internal error. I've had the app for a few days now, I've uninstalled and reinstalled. I'm using Android. Please advise.
replyContent: Hello! Your Google Play services may be out of date, try: 1. Uninstall SlowCOVIDNC 2. Open your phone's settings 3. Tap “Apps” (or “Apps & notifications”) and then “See all apps” 4. Scroll down and tap Google Play services 5. Scroll down and tap “App Details” 6. Tap Update or Install 7. Re-install SlowCOVIDNC Email us at NCHealthIT@dhhs.nc.gov.

content: This app is great and it could be very beneficial in stopping the spread of COVID. It does need to be advertised more on social media and regular media in order for people to learn about it, since it is not functional app if less than 1% of people in NC use it. I only learned about it today, and I'm pretty tech savvy and try to stay up to date with COVID news.
We need this to keep us safe! I wish everybody had this on there mobile phones.

Hindsight is 20/20 The concept of every cellphone having this app is amazing! I gave SlowCOVIDNC 4⭐ because of the possibilities! We'll see if it helps in another 90days. The NFL teams that are using something similar have had great outcomes & information shared.

We have had SlowCOVIDNC for a week now.  It was very easy to install and use. Since installing the app, we have not noticed any additional battery drain.  We don't understand why this app is not being used more widely. At this writing only about 10K+ have been downloaded in a state with a population of over 10M+.  Also, it might be nice if the app told you if you had contact with someone using the app (you could make the disclosure optional). Thanks for finally getting a COVID app out there.
replyContent: Hi Peter, This is an interesting idea! For reasons of privacy and security, the app does not allow for this type of feature. Thanks for helping slow the spread of COVID-19 and promoting the adoption of this app!

content: It does exactly as it should. A sharing feature is the only missing option. With this app being dependant on community involvement I'm surprised there's no share option already.
replyContent: Hi Brandon, Thanks for your help in slowing the spread of COVID-19! Our development team is actively working on a sharing feature. Thanks again!

content: Easy to install. If enough people install it, it could be helpful.
Everyone, please install this app! The more people install it, the more effective it is.
Glad NC finally got a tracing app!
Low effort way to protect yourself and others. Just download it and then keep your phone on you. I wish they'd thought of this sooner.

Yall, there is no location tracking in this app. Think of it like a game of tag: You know who tagged you, they know who tagged them, etc. Together that creates one big web of connection without any location tracking. It's also built with a Google/Apple system which disallows random data to be sent or received. PS. Both Republicans and Democrats support this app. If you want businesses and schools reopened, then download the app, slow the virus spread, and let's get our economy back on track.
Extremely simple. Non-invasive. Great execution!
This is a great solution to a hard shared problem. I'm telling everyone I know to download the app right away, keep Bluetooth on and report anonymously if the do become positive.
Install and ready to get started. Hit "Enable" on first launch, but get "Internal error". Updating Google Play services is not an option at the moment. I guess Huawei phones are not supported 🙁
replyContent: Hi Sam! Your Google Play services may be out of date, try: 1. Uninstall SlowCOVIDNC 2. Open your phone's settings 3. Tap “Apps” (or “Apps & notifications”) and then “See all apps” 4. Scroll down and tap Google Play services 5. Scroll down and tap “App Details” 6. Tap Update or Install 7. Re-install SlowCOVIDNC Email us at NCHealthIT@dhhs.nc.gov.

content: Can't believe a naysayer is the top review right now. Any contact tracing app relies on a large mass of people using it. Their whataboutism with "How is this going to work?" and "I don't think this is it." is defeatist, narrow minded, and deeply disturbingly stupid. This can work. More people just need to install it and enable it. Then let the app do its job.

Only 4⭐ until I see how well it works long term. I get that covid19 is the fashionable plague right now; but I think the app should be expanded to include flu and strep throat (possibly other diseases too?) tracing--health concerns which in my experience seem more problematic. I'm not saying covid isn't real or downplaying other's experiences...just thinking the app could be more comprehensive.
replyContent: Hi Timothy! Thank you for sharing your idea and helping Slow the Spread of COVID-19 in North Carolina.

content: Very helpful app and it's extremely easy to use!
Anonymous Bluetooth near point tracking. No GPS location tracking!

NCDHHS' SlowCOVIDNC is an app every North Carolinian should have downloaded to their phone. The app is extremely simple to set up, with privacy and safety a top priority. Download the app today to help slow the spread of COVID-19.

Just downloaded SlowCOVIDNC to my Android phone. Easy to install and enable. As a 26 yr Public Health Nurse, I would be remiss in not trying the app and encouraging others to do so also. Shared to my Facebook page today.
Excellent and anonymous, doesn't use your location data -- only uses encrypted tokens over Bluetooth.
The more people use it, the more benefit it has. Thank you for getting this done!
Great Demo of how it works. Can't give it 5 stars until I know it works as advertised.
Glad to have this! It's not government tracking and anyone who says otherwise is simply wrong. Would be nice to add a share button in the app to encourage everyone to download and use this app.
replyContent: Hi David, Thanks for the great idea! I’ll share this with the development team. Thanks again!

Thank you for making this, I hope every North Carolinian uses this app.
